channel.title: A virus with a sense of humour
channel.description:
[img]https://removal-tool.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/11/SystemTool_2011.jpg[/img]
This just appeared on some of our computers at work. Cannot stop laughing.

item.title: A virus with a sense of humour
item.dc:creator: Pyroclase
item.description:
I hate those things. They’re just annoying, really.

Read full topic

item.title: A virus with a sense of humour
item.dc:creator: mralexs
item.description:
bigfan421:

it would be like
you beat level 6-7 in Super meat boy
“Fuck yeah, I finally got past 6-7”
virus strikes[Problem, Gamer?]
“FFFFFFFFFFFFFUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUU”

LOL! but ya, that would be right

item.title: A virus with a sense of humour
item.dc:creator: Maverix26
item.description:
I never send viruses to my slaves.

A RAT, bot, and keylogger are my primary weapons(;

Edit: And after a good 130~140 slaves, i think it’s done me some good.

item.title: A virus with a sense of humour
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
the worst that can happen is the HDD firmware gets wiped, you can do the same for the RAM and other components, but you need a massive collection of drivers and most virus makers just want a backdoor into the system to use it as a proxy for other e-crimes or to sell it for someone to use it in that effect

if you’re accused of piracy just tell them you have viruses

Read full topic

item.source: A virus with a sense of humour

item.title: A virus with a sense of humour
item.dc:creator: The_Minotaur
item.description:
sersoft:

the piece you see missing on the pic actually hit me right above the eyebrow, I was going to touch the chip to see if it got hot

the testing board was an asus p2b (pentium III) that doesn’t support bios flashing from windows, my virus had real potential.

Wait, your virus not only physically melted the chip, it actually made it explode? :fffuuu:

That is one cool virus you’ve created there. Though I’m glad you didn’t release it, I can’t help but wonder what would happen if you had. :3

Read full topic
item.source: A virus with a sense of humour

item.title: A virus with a sense of humour
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
Door:

Shame it didn’t explode on your face, that’d have all sorts of innuendo.
But… wait, you tested it on yourself? :fffuuu:

the piece you see missing on the pic actually hit me right above the eyebrow, I was going to touch the chip to see if it got hot

the testing board was an asus p2b (pentium III) that doesn’t support bios flashing from windows, my virus had real potential.

item.dc:creator: BaTz281
item.description:
I worked for a computer repair center for about 6 months (2008-2009) and I would see that virus at least once a week (actually took a picture with my phone the first time I saw it because I, too, started laughing uncontrollably). Entertaining virus, that one

item.title: A virus with a sense of humour
item.dc:creator: Piefish
item.description:
sersoft:

I once made a virus that replaces the boot loader with a collection of BIOS flash programs that automatically erase the BIOS and then formats the hard drive before rebooting. I decided it was too dangerous because a bios chip exploded in my face during testing.

Don’t create viruses then

Read full topic

item.description:
I once made a virus that replaces the boot loader with a collection of BIOS flash programs that automatically erase the BIOS and then formats the hard drive before rebooting. I decided it was too dangerous because a bios chip exploded in my face during testing.
